intro: Agave sobria, commonly known as the Mexican weeping agave, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically blue-gray in color with a waxy coating. The plant produces a tall flowering stalk that bears yellowish-green flowers, which bloom in the spring. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid environments. Agave sobria is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
